is a beach on the island of

value: Salad Beach on Ko Pha Ngan

content=Chef Tummys Thai Cooking school is one of Thailand's only sea view cooking schools. With classes in the morning and evening each student enjoys an individual wok to put some of Chef Tummy's skilled advice and guidance into action. Trips to the local market and an overview of the delights of Thai cooking are part of the programme. Chef Tummy also delights with tales of shipwreck and adventure from his pirate days in the Caribbean.
directions=middle of the beach, between Coral Beach and Asia Bungalow,
content=Great seafood at Ben's. Seating under the stars, great music. Owner is a local girl named Ben.
directions=Just about dead centre of Haad Salad

content=Tasty Thai and green salads, good bread with the breakfast scramble, muesli, coffee, espresso, cappuccino, ice cream, and the usual assortment of Thai and Western foods, with sunset view from the beach side restaurant.
content=Beautiful beach, great views and friendly (also excellent) service. Regularly voted one of Ko Pha Ngan's best resorts. Call for pick-up from the pier.
directions=12 min from main pier Thong Sala.
content=3 styles of bungalow (fan, hot water, air conditioned). Walk to the beach. Swimming pool, basketball court, restaurant, shops and business centre.
content=Three different styles of wooden beach front villa and three styles of hotel room. With an in-house cooking school, spa, restaurant, and large swimming pool.

content=A 5 minute walk from the beach. Rooms are nice. Air-con or fan rooms. This could be a fine place to stay, though there are better comparable options (Haad Salaad Resort), and less expensive (My Way) just a short walk away, and both are actually on the beach. If they replace a staff member or two, Smile Beach could be a good option.
